ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: An in-depth picture of the Romantic poets and the necessary tools to write about them.
This course is exactly as it seems: a survey of the English Romantic poets, touching on their major works and influences.
I learned to be a more patient and careful reader of poetry in light of Romantic traditions.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This is a fantastic course and I have no constructive criticisms.
The strength of this course is its collection of readings which is both challenging and a joy the read. The weakness of this course is sometimes the perceived narrow reading of some of the texts.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: This course offers an opportunity that you'll never have once you graduate Yale. Professor Brisman is an incredibly committed, kind, and brilliant instructor who will guide you through some of the English language's most beautiful writers. The material also has the power to change your relationship to nature, revolution, and sympathy.
Absolutely. I think every Yale student should take a course from Professor Brisman and every Yale student should dive into an era of poetry.
One must earnestly enjoy both challenging reading and challenging writing, but provided that is the case, I would recommend this to anyone.
I would recommend this course to any student who wants to be exposed to or interested in Romantic themes while also learning to read poetry like a scholar might.
